answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found several templates for you to use. 
First, I have included the Jefferson County, Colorado records management, procedures, and standards manual.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/9242/Records_Management_Policies_Procedures_and_Standards_Manual
I was also able to find the records management manual from several states.
Massachusetts: 
http://www.sec.state.ma.us/arc/arcpdf/MA_Municipal_Records_Retention_Manual.pdf
Michigan:
http://www.michigan.gov/documents/hal_mhc_rms_Local_RM_Manual_116243_7.pdf
Virginia:
http://www.lva.virginia.gov/agencies/records/manuals/vprmm.pdf
Illinois:
http://www.cyberdriveillinois.com/departments/archives/records_management/srm_disaster_plan.html
Pennsylvania:  
http://www.portal.state.pa.us/portal/server.pt/document/775617/m210_7
I hope these help! 
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

answers.author: Kyle Stannert
answers.text:
Do they want a manual, or simply need a retention schedule?  Most agencies probably have intranet help sites now.  In addition to the ones listed by Ali (above) I would recomend the following two sources of inspiration - 
Ohio State University:
http://library.osu.edu/projects-initiatives/osu-records-management/
University of Washington:
http://f2.washington.edu/fm/recmgt/
Have them get in touch with me directly and I'll try to share some books / resources to get started.

author: Toni Shope
text:
A locality is working on the development of a Records Management Manual.  Please share a template you might have available. 
Thank you.
title: Records Management Manual
